skillTree.name: Elven Steed
skillTree.description: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

skillTree.name: Unicorn
skillTree.description: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellsinger where their magical gifts are needed most.

skillTree.name: Great Eagle
skillTree.description: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

skillTree.name: Speed of the Hunter
skillTree.description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.

skillTree.name: Rain of Spines
skillTree.description: A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.

skillTree.name: Ward of Isha
skillTree.description: Isha's protection can protect the faithful Asrai through the darkest of days.

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Weaver of the Winds
skillTree.description: All Elves are intrinsically magical beings, but Asrai Spellweavers practice spellcraft free of Ulthuan’s stiff-necked morality and Naggaroth’s heedless sadism.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +15% when increasing

skillTree.name: Loec's Blessing
skillTree.description: Using rhythmic incantations endowed and employed by Loec himself to avoid Slaanesh’s gaze, one can stay unseen and uncaught.

skillTree.name: Forest's Fury
skillTree.description: Skilled spellweavers can turn the forest upon their enemies with frightening ease, summoning grasping, twisted roots and branches to smother their foes.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 15 men unit or above
Strong vs single and multiple units

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Apotheosis Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Hand of Glory"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Hand of Glory Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Hand of Glory Upgraded"

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Soul Quench"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Soul Quench Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Soul Quench Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Tempest Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Arcane Unforging"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Arcane Unforging Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Arcane Unforging Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Fiery Convocation"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Fiery Convocation Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Fiery Convocation Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Call of the Woods
skillTree.description: The Lord embodies the forest; as a result of this, their warriors feel a greater call to defend it.

skillTree.name: Howl of the Forest
skillTree.description: The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.

skillTree.name: The Eye of Kurnous
skillTree.description: The Lord sets their eye upon the foe, imbuing their troops with Kurnous' spirit and the will to see his enemies destroyed.

skillTree.name: Sight Beyond Sight
skillTree.description: This Lord can spot an enemy at a distance that defies belief, and demands their troops do the same.

skillTree.name: Dance of Loec
skillTree.description: This ritualistic war dance requires neither rhythm nor order, enabling evasion of the enemy’s clumsy attacks, and lethal counterattacks.

skillTree.name: Possessed by the Trickster God
skillTree.description: Once consumed by Loec’s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Piercing Thorns
skillTree.description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Bolts of the Forest
skillTree.description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +4% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Striking Branches
skillTree.description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

effects.description:
Speed: +6% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +9% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Swinging Boughs
skillTree.description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ancient Bark
skillTree.description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

effects.description:
Armour: +6 for Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 3% for Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 6% for Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Wings of the Forest
skillTree.description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +4% for Hawk Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for Hawk Riders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Shield of the Forest
skillTree.description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Nature's Quiver
skillTree.description: What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Swift & Sturdy
skillTree.description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Glade Riders, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: The Forest's Roar
skillTree.description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Grove Guardians, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tree Kin, Grove Guardians, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Tree Kin, Grove Guardians, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ever-Reaching Tendrils
skillTree.description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.

skillTree.name: Wonders of the Forest
skillTree.description: Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.

skillTree.name: Nature's Salve
skillTree.description: The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.

skillTree.name: Obscuring Canopy
skillTree.description: The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.

skillTree.name: Growth of the Forest
skillTree.description: The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.

skillTree.name: Open Branches
skillTree.description: From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Swiftfingers
skillTree.description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.name: Perenniality
skillTree.description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.

skillTree.name: Quartermaster
skillTree.description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.

skillTree.name: Home Amongst the Boughs
skillTree.description: The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Ariel's Chosen
backgroundSkills.description: Those whom the Mage Queen has favoured fight as if powered by her hand.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +10% when increasing

Melee attack: +2 during forest battles
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.name: Fleet-Footed
backgroundSkills.description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

backgroundSkills.name: Cunning
backgroundSkills.description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.name: Determined
backgroundSkills.description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

backgroundSkills.name: Confident
backgroundSkills.description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Disciplined
backgroundSkills.description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.

backgroundSkills.name: Perceptive
backgroundSkills.description: Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

backgroundSkills.name: Aggressive
backgroundSkills.description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.

backgroundSkills.name: Tough
backgroundSkills.description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.

backgroundSkills.name: Knowledgeable
backgroundSkills.description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

backgroundSkills.name: Intelligent
backgroundSkills.description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

Ambush defence chance: +20%
	(all units in army)

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.name: Chosen of Asuryan
backgroundSkills.description: Atop a great pyramid in the highest heaven, Asuryan watches over the world alone and has never been seen by mortals.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -4% for Great Eagle and Hawk Rider units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Hoeth Wisdom
backgroundSkills.description: Whatever the motivation, legend tells that when Asuryan learned of Hoeth's actions, he rebuked the Lord of Wisdom, and in punishment, set much of Hoeth's great library ablaze.

backgroundSkills.name: Blessing of Isha
backgroundSkills.description: As the goddess of nature, Isha taught the Elves how to care for the land and gain a plentiful harvest.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.name: Ways of Ladrielle
backgroundSkills.description: By tradition, she is the only goddess to any longer walk the mortal world, and there are tales of her coming to the aid of those lost amidst the mists of Yvresse or upon the trackless ocean.

backgroundSkills.name: Light of Lileath
backgroundSkills.description: It is claimed that she reads the intention written in the heart of every elf and judges them not by their deeds, but by their hearts desire.

backgroundSkills.name: Blade of Loec
backgroundSkills.description: The Elf legends tell that Loec often saves the souls of the dead from Slaanesh by tricking the Dark Prince out of his prize.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -10% when increasing
	(enemy armies in region)

backgroundSkills.name: Vaul's Will
backgroundSkills.description: Enslaved to Khaine's will, Vaul is forced to make weapons of extraordinary power for the War God's eternal battle against the great enemy.
